Isolation: Remote employees may feel isolated and disconnected from the rest of the team. This can lead to feelings of loneliness and decrease motivation.
Technical difficulties: Remote work requires the use of technology, which can be subject to technical difficulties. This can lead to downtime and delays in work.
Distractions: Remote employees may experience more distractions at home, which can lead to decreased focus and productivity.
Lack of recognition: Remote employees may feel that they are not appreciated or recognized for their contributions, which can lead to decreased motivation.
Time management: Remote employees may struggle with time management and work/life balance, which can lead to burnout.
